name: Charlotte, NC
tagline: New South energy meets banking hustle in a diverse, sprawling metro

diversity.summary: Charlotte is genuinely diverse with a substantial Black population (~35%) and growing Hispanic and Asian communities. About 18% of newlyweds 2011-2015 were interracial couples. The city has a visible Black middle class, strong economic growth in diverse communities, and a 'New South' vibe that feels more welcoming than old-guard Southern cities. Some segregation exists but overall climate is good.
diversity.diversity_index: 35% Black, 15% Hispanic, 6% Asian, growing multiracial population
diversity.notable: Lincoln County saw 28% Black population growth 2019-2024

safety.summary: Overall crime down 8% and violent crime down 25% in first half of 2025 vs 2024. Northwest Charlotte is safest; western areas have had higher property crime. Compared to Denver, Charlotte feels safer in most neighborhoods. Chance of being a victim is 1 in 136 for violent crime.

scenery.summary: Modest scenery—tree-lined neighborhoods and some rolling hills, but no dramatic natural features. Comfortable suburban greenery. Not a scenic destination, but pleasant enough. 1-2 hours to Blue Ridge Mountains.

climate.summary: Humid subtropical with four seasons. Hot, humid summers; mild winters with occasional snow (melts quickly). Spring and fall are beautiful. More humidity than Denver, less dramatic weather.

culture.summary: Banking and NASCAR heritage meeting urban renaissance. Growing food scene (BBQ, Southern fusion, international), NASCAR Hall of Fame, decent arts scene, and live music. Not as culturally rich as Nashville or Austin, but improving. Feels like a city on the rise—young, ambitious, business-focused.

pros: Strong racial diversity and visible Black middle class
Very affordable compared to LA (significant savings)
Safe neighborhoods with good options for families
cons: Very car-dependent outside a few neighborhoods
Scenery is underwhelming (no mountains, no water)
Summer heat and humidity can be intense

neighborhoods.name: Dilworth
neighborhoods.vibe: Historic, tree-lined, walkable streetcar suburb with charm
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Best walkability + safety + character combo. Mature trees, local cafes, farmers markets. Close to Uptown. Great for their vibe.

neighborhoods.name: South End
neighborhoods.vibe: Charlotte's urban revival—former industrial, now trendy apartments and light rail
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Walkable, on the light rail, art galleries and breweries. Less established than Dilworth but energetic. Good for Josh's wanderlust.

neighborhoods.name: Plaza Midwood
neighborhoods.diversity_notes: Most diverse neighborhood, very accepting of interracial couples
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Artistic, funky, genuinely diverse. Vintage shops, indie venues. Feels authentic, not manufactured. Strong LGBTQ+ and mixed-race community.

neighborhoods.name: NoDa (North Davidson)
neighborhoods.vibe: Arts district turned trendy neighborhood—galleries, music, nightlife
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Cultural hub with character. Walkable, vibrant, feels like 'somewhere.' Can be gritty in spots but authentic.

neighborhoods.name: Myers Park
neighborhoods.vibe: Old-money Charlotte—historic mansions, tree canopy, refined
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Beautiful and safe but less walkable and less diverse. May feel too establishment/homogeneous for their adventure vibe.
